title: Principles of Communism
description: The most ideal introductory work in my opinion; it contains 25 questions about communism for which answers are provided. Written by Friedrich Engels in 1847.

title: The Three Sources and Three Component Parts of Marxism
description: A short but important document. Lenin stresses in every way possible that Marxism emerged as a natural result of the entire preceding history.

title: Wage Labour and Capital
description: The predecessor to Capital, in this text Marx goes over his ideas in slightly more detail and begins to introduce more terminology.

title: Capital Volume 1
description: A mandatory read for anyone who is really serious about Marxism. It is a big commitment though, so make sure you read slowly and do not be afraid to look for external resources to help yourself understand. An absolutely indespensable reading.
